messages.messageBody:
My son discovered super glue 2 days ago and everything
has either been broke 
so it could be fixed or glue down, shut, open etc. We
now have crayon and a 
lighter glued to my counter!! (yes he also glued the
lighter wheel so it 
dont actually work anymore).
Congrats on the underwear Asa!


Eeek!! We've discovered masking-tape's great for model-
making!! The kids love it, I don't have glue-y things
to clean up and we don't waste as much!! I was fixing
things with super-glue and managed to blob some on my
finger... it came off eventually...

Tracy

messages.messageBody:
>From: diamondair@...
>Reply-To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] They're out
>Date: Mon, 18 Jun 2001 02:13:00 -0000
>
My son discovered super glue 2 days ago and everything has either been broke
so it could be fixed or glue down, shut, open etc. We now have crayon and a
lighter glued to my counter!! (yes he also glued the lighter wheel so it
dont actually work anymore).
Congrats on the underwear Asa!

Indiana Tami-who wishes Collin had found tape :)(but glad the spiderman
phase is over for timebeing :)
>-Robin-
>who is glad of the slow mail on this list as we just spent a few days
>camping and didn't have to come home to an avalanche of mail...
>
>Blue Skies!
> -Robin-
>Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "I like to create lots of things, and they
>all
>need tape!"
>and Asa (10/5/99) who is wearing underwear!

messages.subject: They're out
messages.msgSnippet: This week is the time of year when I realize how spoiled we are the rest of the year. Yes, school is out for the summer and the parks, museums, campgrounds,
messages.messageBody:
This week is the time of year when I realize how spoiled we are the
rest of the year. Yes, school is out for the summer and the parks,
museums, campgrounds, playgrounds, concerts, and pools are full
again! It sure makes me appreciate our 9 months of relative peace and
quiet (that is, unless a school group happens to unload a busfull at
wherever we happen to be).

-Robin-
who is glad of the slow mail on this list as we just spent a few days
camping and didn't have to come home to an avalanche of mail...

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
Mom to Mackenzie (8/28/96) "I like to create lots of things, and they
all
need tape!"
and Asa (10/5/99) who is wearing underwear!
http://www.geocities.com/the_clevengers Flying Clevenger Family
